summary: Always In Our Hearts
title: Always In Our Hearts
body:
AN: This was written for my friend who is just joining the fandom! I want her to suffer!

Pairing: No reader insert, just irondad angst.

Word Count: 762

Warning: Endgame spoilers!! Very sad!!

    You told me once that you wanted me to be better than you, and I don’t see how that’s really possible. You hated yourself more than anyone else could and it’s really unfair. I heard you sometimes, I wonder if you ever knew.

     You were in my thoughts at three A.M again.
I had a bio test the next day, and I knew that I should have studied but I couldn’t. I guess it’s weird that anytime I open my textbook a few tears find their way out of my eyes. I think I wish that people around me would look at me strangely when it happens, but they don’t. People are generally less abrasive now.
     It drives me fucking insane.
     The fact that it took Flash three weeks to start calling me Penis Parker again. The fact that MJ stopped poking fun of me for being “Tony Stark’s literal fucking shadow Jesus Christ, Pete.” The fact that Ned stopped asking about how it was to basically be an avenger (I don’t think I told him you made me one. I don’t think I told him about a lot.) The world was in mourning for five years, things can’t just go back to the way they once were. Oh how I wish they could.
    I can’t hear certain words the same without you.
    You told me once that you wanted me to be better than you, and I don’t see how that’s really possible. You hated yourself more than anyone else could and it’s really unfair. I heard you sometimes, I wonder if you ever knew. You would make a joke to the team and we would all laugh, but I heard you. The way you blame yourself for Ultron. The way you would blame yourself for Pietro. I could hear the pain in your heart whenever you mentioned Steve, and all the friends you lost.
    It was never your fault.
    May told me that I’m more like you than I could ever realize. It took me a few hours to stop crying after that. It was probably all I ever wanted to hear, but I didn’t want to hear it from her lips. Maybe it was a dumb thing to cry over, maybe I need to get over it. I just don’t think I can.
    You’re in my dreams.
     Most of the time when I wake up, I’ll be covered in sweat and free of breath. For a while, all I could think of was the way it felt to become nothing. I’ve heard that for the vast majority of people it felt like nothing at all, that most people didn’t even realize they were disappearing until they saw the looks of horror on the faces around them. I felt every single millimeter of my body separate from itself, and I could feel the panic that everyone felt when they started to go. I never want to feel something like that again, and I don’t know if anything will ever compare.
     Sometimes when I close my eyes I can see your face.
     You looked so tired that all I wanted to tell you was that it was okay to close your eyes, but I was too selfish to say that. I knew what would happen if you closed your eyes. Pepper was always looking out for your interests, so I’m not surprised that she was the one who told you. You always listened to her. I wanted to scream at her to tell you to hang on just a little longer. I wanted so badly for you to stay with me-with us for just a few more seconds. Maybe Strange could conjure some other-worldly cure, maybe Thor could produce an Asguardian potion that kept you alive. You probably would have stayed alive if you saw the look on Pepper’s face when you closed your eyes.
     I just wish you knew what you did.
     Sometimes I get angry when I think about how much you hated yourself. There were so many times I just wanted to grab you and for you to really hear the words I was saying to you. You would laugh when I told you that you had always been my hero, tell me with faux confidence that Iron Man was most kids’ hero. Maybe I should have told you sooner that it wasn’t because of the money, the fame, or really the technology. You were always a just a good man, you were good and generous and kind. I was a kid from Queens, there was never a reason to care about me. Even with my powers I never really mattered in the grand scheme of things, but I mattered to you for some reason. My life was important to you.
     You were important to me, Tony.

AN: Thoughts?

Taglist: @kenzie-cold-greenkale

summary: So, imagine Peter and Harley in a war, and are on different sides. And it's a Prank War. Tony and the other avengers are in the...
question: So, imagine Peter and Harley in a war, and are on different sides. And it's a Prank War. Tony and the other avengers are in the middle of this, and sometimes (most of the times) have to endure Peter's or Harley's pranks, and soon the avengers pick sides and join the prank war :)
answer:
I would not envy the souls who get in between the two boys. 

Send help for their poor souls.

 First off I believe the two boys would start the whole prank war with something pretty petty. Like when Harley ate the last pineapple pizza when Peter was in the bathroom, the time Harley bought 5 cartons of mint ice cream even though he knew Peter despised mint with a burning passion, or that time where Harley chased Peter down for throwing a bunch of potatoes at him ‘FOR THE MEMES’. That’s pretty much how the war would start! They’re both salty and need revenge cause they’re just like that.

Now to the utter torture that was the weeks before the War of Parkner.

The Avengers were terrified. Like out right scared for their lives. The first day was a living nightmare. Natasha being the super awesome spy she is noticed the tensions rising in the tower so she thought best to go on a road trip for a few weeks with Wanda and Vision. Rhodey knew what was up so him and Nebula joined too because they ain’t about to die an early death.

They were the only ones spared from the massacre that was the many battles of Parkner.

Anyway, for the first few days of the prank wars Peter and Harley absolutely went ham. One time Peter decided to web up the training room into a whole maze and once you got caught no one ever gets out. That was the day where they lost Clint. There’s no question about it they just LOST HIM. It’s okay though because you can still hear his screams somewhere in the tower!

At this point every one is pretty terrified. Harley already pelted them with potatoes that morning and it hurt like a bitch. No one has seen Harley or Peter for a few days and that started to worry them. Sam, Bucky, and Steve always have to check the tower on a daily basis now. Tony locked himself in the lab so he didn’t have to deal with the after math that was the war. Carol was laughing her ass off while simultaneously being on alert. Did I mention that EVERYONE was a little scared? Except Pepper, Pepper was just done with this household. At some point Morgan wanted to join to ,but Tony refused to be killed by his children that day.

As soon as they heard about what they did to Steve the Avengers soon picked sides to have some alliance with at least one of the teens. Poor Steve got trapped in a room and had to watch all his PSAs for 9 hours straight. 

He was mortified after he came pack from the room he had dubbed as ‘The American Hell Hole’. 

Carol, Sam, and Bucky joined Harley’s army of destruction. Sam and Bucky were both still salty that Peter kicked their asses so that was a given. Carol just liked watching Harley physically and mentally torturing Steve. Meanwhile Steve, a hesitant Bruce, and Scott joined Peter’s team. They were all too scared of the boy’s webs to do anything. The starks remained neutral. 

Even though Morgan wanted to join in the destruction of the Avengers.

Let me just have the honor of saying that the war was HEATED. Each side were fighting for their lives. Peter was constantly webbing up everything from food to important government papers (Much to Pepper’s disapproval). Harley however had just watched ‘Home Alone’ and he became a fucking mastermind. He plays his cards to the fullest potential. He was like an actual general of pranks at that point.

The two were at each other’s neck for weeks. Just as Harley and Peter were going one on one at each other. Peter throwing fart bombs while Harley was shooting slime shots at him. Everyone else skedaddled at this point and headed out for some Starbucks. 

Harley managed to shoot some slime on Peter’s hands just as the younger boy was swinging. Peter began to slip and fall from the high Tower ceilings. In the middle of his own panic Harley quickly manages to catch Peter in his arms, holding the smaller boy bridle style in his arms.

Peter blinked at Harley. Harley merely stared at him before kissing the boy. Peter let out a surprised squeak as his face started to heat up. It soon became a tickle fight between the two boys. Each boy laughing louder as the other tickles them. The two ended up cuddling each other for the rest of the day.

They both mentally agreed that the prank war was totally worth it in the end.

Tony locked himself in the lab so he didn’t have to deal with the after math that was the war. Carol was laughing her ass off while simultaneously being on alert. Did I mention that EVERYONE was a little scared? Except Pepper, Pepper was just done with this household. At some point Morgan wanted to join to ,but Tony refused to be killed by his children that day.

As soon as they heard about what they did to Steve the Avengers soon picked sides to have some alliance with at least one of the teens. Poor Steve got trapped in a room and had to watch all his PSAs for 9 hours straight. 

He was mortified after he came pack from the room he had dubbed as ‘The American Hell Hole’. 

Carol, Sam, and Bucky joined Harley’s army of destruction. Sam and Bucky were both still salty that Peter kicked their asses so that was a given. Carol just liked watching Harley physically and mentally torturing Steve. Meanwhile Steve, a hesitant Bruce, and Scott joined Peter’s team. They were all too scared of the boy’s webs to do anything. The starks remained neutral. 

Even though Morgan wanted to join in the destruction of the Avengers.

Let me just have the honor of saying that the war was HEATED. Each side were fighting for their lives. Peter was constantly webbing up everything from food to important government papers (Much to Pepper’s disapproval). Harley however had just watched ‘Home Alone’ and he became a fucking mastermind. He plays his cards to the fullest potential. He was like an actual general of pranks at that point.

The two were at each other’s neck for weeks. Just as Harley and Peter were going one on one at each other. Peter throwing fart bombs while Harley was shooting slime shots at him. Everyone else skedaddled at this point and headed out for some Starbucks. 

Harley managed to shoot some slime on Peter’s hands just as the younger boy was swinging. Peter began to slip and fall from the high Tower ceilings. In the middle of his own panic Harley quickly manages to catch Peter in his arms, holding the smaller boy bridle style in his arms.

Peter blinked at Harley. Harley merely stared at him before kissing the boy. Peter let out a surprised squeak as his face started to heat up. It soon became a tickle fight between the two boys. Each boy laughing louder as the other tickles them. The two ended up cuddling each other for the rest of the day.

They both mentally agreed that the prank war was totally worth it in the end.
trail.content:
I would not envy the souls who get in between the two boys. 

Send help for their poor souls.

 First off I believe the two boys would start the whole prank war with something pretty petty. Like when Harley ate the last pineapple pizza when Peter was in the bathroom, the time Harley bought 5 cartons of mint ice cream even though he knew Peter despised mint with a burning passion, or that time where Harley chased Peter down for throwing a bunch of potatoes at him ‘FOR THE MEMES’. That’s pretty much how the war would start! They’re both salty and need revenge cause they’re just like that.

Now to the utter torture that was the weeks before the War of Parkner.

The Avengers were terrified. Like out right scared for their lives. The first day was a living nightmare. Natasha being the super awesome spy she is noticed the tensions rising in the tower so she thought best to go on a road trip for a few weeks with Wanda and Vision. Rhodey knew what was up so him and Nebula joined too because they ain’t about to die an early death.

They were the only ones spared from the massacre that was the many battles of Parkner.

Anyway, for the first few days of the prank wars Peter and Harley absolutely went ham. One time Peter decided to web up the training room into a whole maze and once you got caught no one ever gets out. That was the day where they lost Clint. There’s no question about it they just LOST HIM. It’s okay though because you can still hear his screams somewhere in the tower!

summary: Harley plopped down across the table from Peter. It was time for their twice weekly coffee dates where sometimes they studied....
caption:
Harley plopped down across the table from Peter. It was time for their twice weekly coffee dates where sometimes they studied. Judging by the way Peter’s eyebrows were furrowed, they were going to study more than they normally did.
“Biochem?” Harley asked, nudging his leg against Peter’s.
“Mhm,”
Harley snagged his laptop out of his backpack and continued to work on his project, a holographic communication device. He got inspired by one of the many Star Wars marathons he’d had with Tony and the rest of the Avengers.
Tony had been giving him nudges in the right direction, helping him with the math and technology and Peter- Harley glanced up as his boyfriend, whatever he was working on seemed to be making him frustrated- was always there to encourage him. He really loved MIT.

(inspired by their promise in River)

@marvelbingo fill: O5 MIT

summary: (I’m the same anon who requested Peter Parker angst) I just realized prompt 37 says “Do you think they could’ve loved me?” But...
question: (I’m the same anon who requested Peter Parker angst) I just realized prompt 37 says “Do you think they could’ve loved me?” But could you maybe change it slightly to “Do you think you could’ve loved me?”???? Sorry bout that! I hope I’m not being too demanding, I just really love your writing and really wanna be bulldozed by angst
answer:
Peter Parker x Reader

You wanted angst, it’s my job to deliver :) lol I’m kidding but I hope this is what you had in mind! <3 But gAH thank you so much that means the world to me :) 

Prompts:

37: “Do you think you could’ve loved me?”

43: “I am not losing you again!”

6: “You can’t die. Please don’t die!”

“PETER!” You screamed through the crowd of people rushing past you in the streets. Your bus had finally been parked and you and Ned grabbed a taxi towards the threat.

“PETER!” You shouted through sobs. Ned had stopped to help some civilians out of the rubble of fallen buildings. (literally, bless him ned needs more appreciation okay anyWAYS) However, you couldn’t find it in yourself to help right now. All you were concerned about was Peter, your boyfriend of two years fighting against whatever it was.

“Peter Benjamin Parker I swear to god!” You cried out as you frantically began looking for him within the large groups of people. He was nowhere to be found. You pushed back the tears and continued pushing through the crowd of people. You felt your heart leap out of your chest as you saw, at the edge of the crow, Peter. There he stood in his spider-man suit, normally well kept, it was now tattered and covered in dust. Before you could even process what was happening you shoved people out of the way, your feet pounding against the ground as you tried your hardest to reach him.

“(Y/N)” He stuttered out, as he collapsed into your arms. He let his weak body fall, and your knees buckled. You knelt down, holding his upper body in your arms.

“P-p-pete…”

“Hey… baby…” He choked out with a small chuckle. You shook your head and let the tears slide down your cheeks onto his own face.

“Dammit, Peter… w-why.”

“I had to…”

“NO! Peter! No, you didn’t. You think yo-you have to prove yourself but you don’t! You’re the strongest person I know.” You sobbed leaning your head against his. When you pulled yourself back up, he moved a shaky hand up to your cheek.

“Do you think you could’ve loved me?” He choked out, now coughing up bits of blood. You nodded your head and blinked through teary eyes, looking down at him.

“Peter, I love you so much. More than you could e-ever know…” You whispered, pulling him closer to you.

“I-I love you (Y/N)…” He whispered, and then silence. His chest stopped rising. His body went limp in your arms. His eyes stared back at you, normally full of life. This time they had none.

“No no no no no no, dammit! I am not losing you again! Peter please!” You let out a blood-curdling scream as the streets around you were now empty.

“You can’t die. Please don’t die! Peter come on babe… wake up. PETER!” You yelled placing your hands on his chest and balling up the suit into your fist.

“P-p-please… I love you.” You whispered against his skin. Now lifeless, and cold. You had just lost the one thing that brought meaning to your life. Peter Parker was always there to brighten your day, you were there to take care of him. And now he was gone.

“Do you think you could’ve loved me?” He choked out, now coughing up bits of blood. You nodded your head and blinked through teary eyes, looking down at him.

“Peter, I love you so much. More than you could e-ever know…” You whispered, pulling him closer to you.

“I-I love you (Y/N)…” He whispered, and then silence. His chest stopped rising. His body went limp in your arms. His eyes stared back at you, normally full of life. This time they had none.

“No no no no no no, dammit! I am not losing you again! Peter please!” You let out a blood-curdling scream as the streets around you were now empty.

“You can’t die. Please don’t die! Peter come on babe… wake up. PETER!” You yelled placing your hands on his chest and balling up the suit into your fist.

“P-p-please… I love you.” You whispered against his skin. Now lifeless, and cold. You had just lost the one thing that brought meaning to your life. Peter Parker was always there to brighten your day, you were there to take care of him. And now he was gone.

summary: Braving The Cold
body:
Braving The Cold

Happy wasn’t there.

Okay. No big deal. He could walk home. It wasn’t the first time, and it definitely wouldn’t be the last. Except it was the middle of winter and he was not properly dressed to make the walk back home. He could always call Stephen, but he didn’t want to bother him about something as trivial as a walk in the cold. The man had more important things to worry about.

So he set off towards the subway. That was only a five minute walk, and the ride itself would be another five but at least he would be out of the elements. From the subway to the tower would be ten minutes. Fifteen at most.

Peter jumps into the train just before the door closes and vigorously rubs his hands together and breathes on them. Shit. He was already shivering. He didn’t think it was that cold outside.

The teen jumps out at his stop, zips his sweater all the way up, and throws his hood on after putting his earphones in. Hopefully the music would distract him from the cold. It did for a little while, until about halfway to the tower when he began to shiver so violently, it hurt. Just a little farther, he thought. Then he could curl up on the couch with a heavy blanket and maybe even Levi, and ask Dad to make him some hot chocolate.

Oh good. He wasn’t shivering anymore.

Some part of his brain screamed at him saying no, this was very bad. That he needed to find help. Well…the tower was in view so he would have help soon enough.

Peter stumbles inside and toward the private elevator, makes a few attempts to press the button for the family floor, and then tilts his head back against the wall when the correct button lights up. His vision swam now that he was standing still, and he had to lift one if his arms up just to be sure he was still wearing clothes because he was so cold. As soon as the elevator doors open, he staggers out and slowly makes his way to the kitchen where he finds Tony sitting at the table with coffee and a Starkpad. His father looks up upon his arrival and the smile he had quickly turns into one of horror when Peter decided to get friendly with the floor.

“Peter!” Tony scrambles out of his seat and drops to his knees, and Peter nuzzles his face into the engineer’s hand when he touches it. “You’re ice cold! FRIDAY, tell Stephen to get here right the fuck now!”

Peter wasn’t really aware of what happened after that, but he did feel himself being carried at one point, and then he was against something warm and it was heaven. He used whatever strength he had left to press himself against the heat as he felt himself being cocooned. His senses gradually came back after what seemed like forever and the first thing he smelt was tea leaves and incense. He knew that scent belonged to somebody but he couldn’t quite put his finger on it yet. The first thing he heard was yelling and it sounded both angry and worried and that upset him so he returned his focus to the smell.

Tea leaves and incense. Tea leaves and incense…

Stephen.

Peter slowly opens his eyes to find himself pressed against the sorcerer’s bare chest and his nose buried in his collarbone. Okay. He solved that mystery, but it wasn’t Stephen who was yelling. In fact, the man was silent as he rubbed soothing circles onto the teen’s bare back where Levi was gently resting. So the cloak was the cocoon.

That only left the obvious answer that Tony must be the one yelling. It took a couple more seconds of focus for his sense of hearing to come back and Peter cringes at the sudden onslaught of noise.

“There was no text Happy! I checked his phone! Next time you sit outside the gates if you can’t wait in your usual spot! I never want to see my kid take a nose dive to the floor like that again!” Tony mumbles incoherently when, Peter assumes, he hangs up the phone. “How’s he doing Mama Bear?”

“He’s coming back. He could probably handle something warm to drink now.”

“Hot chocolate for the baby. I’ll be right back.”

Even if Peter could speak, he wouldn’t try to deny being called a baby. He probably looked like one curled up against Stephen, and it felt too nice for him to care. Although when he did manage to croak out some semblance of a word it was, “Mum.” How British of him.

Stephen’s chest vibrates with his chuckles. “Feeling better Spiderling?”

“Hnn.” Because really, that’s how he felt and that’s all he could muster.

A collection of relieved sighs reaches Peter’s ears and he attempts to lift his impossibly heavy head to see who else was them. The sorcerer pushes his head back down to his collarbone and Peter miraculously doesn’t fight him. The warm swathe Stephen had him trapped in was too nice anyway.

“I wouldn’t do that.”

Peter would recognize that Russian lilt anywhere. Natasha was talking to someone. Someone who apparently didn’t take her warning seriously because Stephen’s magic crackles around them before pushing away whoever got too close. That someone curses when they hit the floor and others in the room laugh at their misfortune.

Rhodey was the next to speak. “That’s not Mom Mode Barton. Strange is in full-on Mama Bear Mode. Only Tones is getting close.”

Peter felt Stephen’s grumble before he heard it. “Please stop talking about me like I’m not here.”

“Man, I was just worried about the kid. You didn’t need to throw me across the room!”

The Avengers ignore him and go back to their separate activities, and Peter soon feels himself being extracted from his cocoon to which he whines pathetically. He was comfortable!

“I know Underoos…but I brought hot chocolate. Drink this then you can snuggle with Mama Bear all you want.”

Peter wasn’t about to argue with that, so he accepts the mug of chocolate and slowly drinks the contents with Levi still wrapped around his shoulders. He ignores the concerned glances from their teammates because he was beginning to suspect that he passed out in front of them, and that was embarrassing. Not including the cuddle fest he had with Stephen, but that was something they were used to seeing.

“What happened?” Peter asks quietly and vaguely registers the sorcerer putting his shirt back on.

Tony and Stephen look at each other and the billionaire sighs. “You shaved about ten years of my life.”

“We think your spider DNA keeps you from thermoregulating.” The sorcerer finally answers.

Tony snorts. “Yeah. So let’s not have a repeat of today. If Happy isn’t there, you call someone alright?”

Peter nods numbly. “Yeah. Okay.”

He places his empty mug on the coffee table, his body pleasantly warm and fuzzy, and then practically falls back over onto Stephen and nuzzles his shoulder. Levi wiggles away and floats behind the couch as Tony replaces the cloak with a heavy blanket and then briefly moves the pair’s feet to sit on the couch. He moves their feet back onto his lap, places his own on the coffee table, and then glances around at the full living room.

“Why do I bother giving you guys your own floors if you keep taking over mine?”

Steve smiles but doesn’t look up from his notepad. “I’m just up here for that snuggle burrito over there.”

“I’ll pretend you’re drawing fluffy kittens if you give me a copy of that.”

“Deal.”

Soft snores draw the attention of every single person in the room and Tony had to cover his mouth to hide the fond smile that broke to the surface. The snores not only came from Peter, but also from Stephen whose cheek was resting on top of the teen’s head. Brown curls were all that anyone could see since the blanket was pulled up to Peter’s nose and the rest of his face was hidden in the sorcerer’s neck.

“Strange officially has his cub.” Nat whispers affectionately.

Everyone, including Tony, chokes on their laughter.

Rhodey was the next to speak. “That’s not Mom Mode Barton. Strange is in full-on Mama Bear Mode. Only Tones is getting close.”

Peter felt Stephen’s grumble before he heard it. “Please stop talking about me like I’m not here.”

“Man, I was just worried about the kid. You didn’t need to throw me across the room!”

The Avengers ignore him and go back to their separate activities, and Peter soon feels himself being extracted from his cocoon to which he whines pathetically. He was comfortable!

“I know Underoos…but I brought hot chocolate. Drink this then you can snuggle with Mama Bear all you want.”

Peter wasn’t about to argue with that, so he accepts the mug of chocolate and slowly drinks the contents with Levi still wrapped around his shoulders. He ignores the concerned glances from their teammates because he was beginning to suspect that he passed out in front of them, and that was embarrassing. Not including the cuddle fest he had with Stephen, but that was something they were used to seeing.

“What happened?” Peter asks quietly and vaguely registers the sorcerer putting his shirt back on.

Tony and Stephen look at each other and the billionaire sighs. “You shaved about ten years of my life.”

“We think your spider DNA keeps you from thermoregulating.” The sorcerer finally answers.

Tony snorts. “Yeah. So let’s not have a repeat of today. If Happy isn’t there, you call someone alright?”

Peter nods numbly. “Yeah. Okay.”

He places his empty mug on the coffee table, his body pleasantly warm and fuzzy, and then practically falls back over onto Stephen and nuzzles his shoulder. Levi wiggles away and floats behind the couch as Tony replaces the cloak with a heavy blanket and then briefly moves the pair’s feet to sit on the couch. He moves their feet back onto his lap, places his own on the coffee table, and then glances around at the full living room.

“Why do I bother giving you guys your own floors if you keep taking over mine?”

Steve smiles but doesn’t look up from his notepad. “I’m just up here for that snuggle burrito over there.”

“I’ll pretend you’re drawing fluffy kittens if you give me a copy of that.”

“Deal.”

Soft snores draw the attention of every single person in the room and Tony had to cover his mouth to hide the fond smile that broke to the surface. The snores not only came from Peter, but also from Stephen whose cheek was resting on top of the teen’s head. Brown curls were all that anyone could see since the blanket was pulled up to Peter’s nose and the rest of his face was hidden in the sorcerer’s neck.

“Strange officially has his cub.” Nat whispers affectionately.

Everyone, including Tony, chokes on their laughter.
trail.content:
Braving The Cold

Happy wasn’t there.

Okay. No big deal. He could walk home. It wasn’t the first time, and it definitely wouldn’t be the last. Except it was the middle of winter and he was not properly dressed to make the walk back home. He could always call Stephen, but he didn’t want to bother him about something as trivial as a walk in the cold. The man had more important things to worry about.

So he set off towards the subway. That was only a five minute walk, and the ride itself would be another five but at least he would be out of the elements. From the subway to the tower would be ten minutes. Fifteen at most.

Peter jumps into the train just before the door closes and vigorously rubs his hands together and breathes on them. Shit. He was already shivering. He didn’t think it was that cold outside.

The teen jumps out at his stop, zips his sweater all the way up, and throws his hood on after putting his earphones in. Hopefully the music would distract him from the cold. It did for a little while, until about halfway to the tower when he began to shiver so violently, it hurt. Just a little farther, he thought. Then he could curl up on the couch with a heavy blanket and maybe even Levi, and ask Dad to make him some hot chocolate.

Oh good. He wasn’t shivering anymore.

Some part of his brain screamed at him saying no, this was very bad. That he needed to find help. Well…the tower was in view so he would have help soon enough.

Peter stumbles inside and toward the private elevator, makes a few attempts to press the button for the family floor, and then tilts his head back against the wall when the correct button lights up. His vision swam now that he was standing still, and he had to lift one if his arms up just to be sure he was still wearing clothes because he was so cold. As soon as the elevator doors open, he staggers out and slowly makes his way to the kitchen where he finds Tony sitting at the table with coffee and a Starkpad. His father looks up upon his arrival and the smile he had quickly turns into one of horror when Peter decided to get friendly with the floor.

“Peter!” Tony scrambles out of his seat and drops to his knees, and Peter nuzzles his face into the engineer’s hand when he touches it. “You’re ice cold! FRIDAY, tell Stephen to get here right the fuck now!”

Peter wasn’t really aware of what happened after that, but he did feel himself being carried at one point, and then he was against something warm and it was heaven. He used whatever strength he had left to press himself against the heat as he felt himself being cocooned. His senses gradually came back after what seemed like forever and the first thing he smelt was tea leaves and incense. He knew that scent belonged to somebody but he couldn’t quite put his finger on it yet. The first thing he heard was yelling and it sounded both angry and worried and that upset him so he returned his focus to the smell.

Tea leaves and incense. Tea leaves and incense…

Stephen.

Peter slowly opens his eyes to find himself pressed against the sorcerer’s bare chest and his nose buried in his collarbone. Okay. He solved that mystery, but it wasn’t Stephen who was yelling. In fact, the man was silent as he rubbed soothing circles onto the teen’s bare back where Levi was gently resting. So the cloak was the cocoon.

That only left the obvious answer that Tony must be the one yelling. It took a couple more seconds of focus for his sense of hearing to come back and Peter cringes at the sudden onslaught of noise.

“There was no text Happy! I checked his phone! Next time you sit outside the gates if you can’t wait in your usual spot! I never want to see my kid take a nose dive to the floor like that again!” Tony mumbles incoherently when, Peter assumes, he hangs up the phone. “How’s he doing Mama Bear?”

“He’s coming back. He could probably handle something warm to drink now.”

“Hot chocolate for the baby. I’ll be right back.”

Even if Peter could speak, he wouldn’t try to deny being called a baby. He probably looked like one curled up against Stephen, and it felt too nice for him to care. Although when he did manage to croak out some semblance of a word it was, “Mum.” How British of him.

Stephen’s chest vibrates with his chuckles. “Feeling better Spiderling?”

“Hnn.” Because really, that’s how he felt and that’s all he could muster.

A collection of relieved sighs reaches Peter’s ears and he attempts to lift his impossibly heavy head to see who else was them. The sorcerer pushes his head back down to his collarbone and Peter miraculously doesn’t fight him. The warm swathe Stephen had him trapped in was too nice anyway.

“I wouldn’t do that.”

Peter would recognize that Russian lilt anywhere. Natasha was talking to someone. Someone who apparently didn’t take her warning seriously because Stephen’s magic crackles around them before pushing away whoever got too close. That someone curses when they hit the floor and others in the room laugh at their misfortune.

Rhodey was the next to speak. “That’s not Mom Mode Barton. Strange is in full-on Mama Bear Mode. Only Tones is getting close.”

Peter felt Stephen’s grumble before he heard it. “Please stop talking about me like I’m not here.”

“Man, I was just worried about the kid. You didn’t need to throw me across the room!”

The Avengers ignore him and go back to their separate activities, and Peter soon feels himself being extracted from his cocoon to which he whines pathetically. He was comfortable!

“I know Underoos…but I brought hot chocolate. Drink this then you can snuggle with Mama Bear all you want.”

Peter wasn’t about to argue with that, so he accepts the mug of chocolate and slowly drinks the contents with Levi still wrapped around his shoulders. He ignores the concerned glances from their teammates because he was beginning to suspect that he passed out in front of them, and that was embarrassing. Not including the cuddle fest he had with Stephen, but that was something they were used to seeing.

“What happened?” Peter asks quietly and vaguely registers the sorcerer putting his shirt back on.

Tony and Stephen look at each other and the billionaire sighs. “You shaved about ten years of my life.”

“We think your spider DNA keeps you from thermoregulating.” The sorcerer finally answers.

Tony snorts. “Yeah. So let’s not have a repeat of today. If Happy isn’t there, you call someone alright?”

Peter nods numbly. “Yeah. Okay.”

He places his empty mug on the coffee table, his body pleasantly warm and fuzzy, and then practically falls back over onto Stephen and nuzzles his shoulder. Levi wiggles away and floats behind the couch as Tony replaces the cloak with a heavy blanket and then briefly moves the pair’s feet to sit on the couch. He moves their feet back onto his lap, places his own on the coffee table, and then glances around at the full living room.

Steve smiles but doesn’t look up from his notepad. “I’m just up here for that snuggle burrito over there.”

“Deal.”
